caption: Table 1: The Quantitative comparisons with other motion generation methods.
description: This table presents a quantitative comparison of different motion generation methods, including the proposed method and existing state-of-the-art techniques.  The comparison is based on several metrics, including diversity (DIV), beat alignment (BA), Percentage of Correct Keypoints (PCK), and Fréchet Gesture Distance (FGD).  Higher DIV and BA scores indicate better performance, while lower PCK and FGD scores are preferred.

caption: Table 2: Quantitative comparisons with various body animation methods. The * symbol indicates evaluations performed on CyberHost’s 12 demo videos, while ** denotes evaluations conducted on the Vlogger’s 30 demo videos from its homepage.
description: This table presents a quantitative comparison of different body animation methods, evaluating their performance using various metrics such as FID, FVD, SSIM, PNSR, Sync-C, EFID, HKC, HKV, and CSIM.  Lower FID and FVD scores indicate better visual quality, higher SSIM and PNSR scores represent better image quality, and a higher Sync-C score shows better audio-visual synchronization. HKC and HKV assess hand-related aspects of animation quality.  The comparison includes the authors' method, as well as results from CyberHost and Vlogger, obtained by evaluating their publicly available demonstration videos.  The asterisk (*) indicates evaluations performed using CyberHost's 12 demo videos, and the double asterisk (**) denotes evaluations on the 30 demonstration videos from Vlogger's webpage.
